Resources

Your guide to mental well-being—find tools, support, and expert advice all in one place.

Explore a wealth of resources designed to support men's mental health. From practical tools and expert advice to inspiring stories and actionable strategies, we're here to help you navigate your journey. Together, we can break the stigma and prioritize mental well-being—because every step forward matters.


Men's Stories

Jason, an EPR developer, shares his experience with mental health difficulties, emphasizing the importance of seeking help and not suffering in silence.

Read More
6 mins read

  • For immediate support, mental health hotlines are a vital resource. Some of the top options for men facing mental health challenges include:
  • Samaritans (UK): Call 116 123 or visit www.samaritans.org. This helpline is available 24/7 for emotional support and is a lifeline for those feeling in distress or crisis.
  • Lifeline (US): Call 1-800-273-TALK (8255) or visit www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org. This national helpline offers confidential support for anyone in emotional distress.
  • Men's Health Forum (UK): Call 0845 123 23 70 or visit www.menshealthforum.org.uk. This helpline provides support specifically targeted at men's health and mental well-being.

  • A directory of mental health professionals specializing in men's mental health is crucial. Websites like Psychology Today (www.psychologytoday.com) and TherapyRoute.com provide searchable databases where men can find therapists by location, specialty, and insurance coverage.
  • It's essential to ensure that the therapists listed are sensitive to the unique challenges that men often face with mental health, including societal expectations, emotional expression, and coping mechanisms.

  • Online forums and support groups offer a safe space for men to connect and share their experiences.
  • 7 Cups (www.7cups.com) provides anonymous, peer-to-peer support with trained listeners available 24/7.
  • Reddit's r/MensMentalHealth is another great resource where users can share stories, coping strategies, and advice in a supportive community.
  • Forums like these help break the stigma and create a sense of camaraderie for men dealing with mental health challenges.

  • Digital resources like mental health apps can be an effective way for men to practice self-care on their own terms.
  • Apps like Headspace (www.headspace.com) and Calm (www.calm.com) provide guided meditation and mindfulness exercises to help with stress, anxiety, and sleep issues.
  • Moodfit (www.getmoodfit.com) is another app that offers mood tracking, mental health assessments, and personalized suggestions to manage emotional well-being.

  • There are several organizations dedicated to improving men's mental health.
  • Movember (www.movember.com) is known for raising awareness about men's mental health and offering resources and support.
  • Another excellent resource is The Man Cave (www.themancave.org.au), an Australian-based charity that helps boys and men build emotional resilience and foster positive mental health.
  • These organizations provide not only valuable information but also programs and events to engage men in mental wellness.
Men's Mental Health

Men's mental health matters—support, resources, and community for every man.
